newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha easier despite an aggressive bidder.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha easier despite an aggressive bidder.

text.p: NWE naphtha was easier on Friday as the paper market defied crude to shed $2.

A bearish tonne also prevailed on the physical market with the reopening on Thursday of Algeria's Skikda oil port, releasing at least two delayed spot cargoes onto the European market. Another delayed cargo is set to head to Brazil.

A trader was still seen bidding at $228 a tonne cif NWE for a pipeline spec cargo after picking up a 61 paraffin Indian cargo in an exchange on Thursday. But an appropriate cargo was not on offer and some traders said the bidder had a long swaps position.
